channel.title: Home on R-Ladies Sydney
channel.description: Recent content in Home on R-Ladies Sydney

item.title: Basic Basics Lesson 1: RStudio
item.description: Basic Basics Lesson 1: An Opinionated Tour of RStudio Here at R-Ladies Sydney, we‚Äôre a pretty opinionated bunch. In this lesson, we‚Äôre going to impart our opinions1 on navigating RStudio and setting up your workflow. This forms the foundation of all future RYouWithMe lessons - so be sure to follow along carefully! Lesson Outcomes By the end of the lesson, you should: 1.1. Have R and RStudio installed on your machine 1.

item.title: Basic Basics Lesson 2: Packages
item.description: Basic Basics Lesson 2: Installing and Loading Packages You likely won‚Äôt get very far in R without packages. Sure, you could write all the functions you need for your analysis yourself if you wanted, but the great thing about the #rstats community is that people write code, bundle it into packages, and then give them away FOR FREE. Once you are an #rstats expert, you can create your own packages and give back, but for now lets learn what packages are and how to use them.

item.title: Basic Basics Lesson 3: Loading Data
item.description: Basic Basics Lesson 3: Loading Data In this lesson, we‚Äôre going to review how to get data into RStudio, using a specially selected data file that we‚Äôll continue to use for many of the RYouWithMe lessons. Lesson Outcomes By the end of the lesson, you should: 3.1 Have the sydneybeaches.csv data file saved to your RYouWithMe data folder 3.2 Know how to use the here package to tell R where your data is, how to use read_csv to read data from a .

item.title: Basic Basics Overview
item.description: RYouWithMe Unit 1 - Basic Basics In Unit 1, you‚Äôll lay down the foundational knowledge and skills that will carry you through your R journey! Unit 1 has three lessons: An opinionated tour of RStudio Installing and Loading Packages Getting data into RStudio As you embark on Basic Basics, we think this is a useful reminder for R users new and experienced (h/t realpython): Learning R is a journey - we‚Äôre delighted to have you along!

item.title: RYouWithMe
item.description: RYouWithMe: The inspiration I‚Äôm Lisa Williams, a social psychologist at UNSW Sydney, and co-founder of R-Ladies Sydney. Truth be told, I‚Äôm a complete R newbie. Sure, I‚Äôve executed a few commands here and there. But I‚Äôve found R daunting: the workflow, the pure number of packages, and the ‚Äòcross-your-fingers-and-hope‚Äô nature of executing a command. Yet, increasingly, R is the answer to many of my problems - from data wrangling to visualisation to analysis, the result of my searches for how to achieve something is: ‚Äúyou can do it in R‚Äù.

item.title: Tidyverse for Beginners
item.description: Workshop plan Are you new to this R business and short on time? Would you like to start working with data in R without having to go through the arduous process of learning all the programming details first? Do you have a neat data set you‚Äôd like to explore and visualise? This might be the workshop for you! Or are you an experienced old school R programmer who learned how to do everything in base R?

item.title: Launch Event: Lightning Talks
item.description:
We are super excited to announce that R-Ladies Sydney will launch on June 20th 2018 üéâ. For our first event, we want everyone to meet someone new and learn something new so we plan to host a series of lightning talks ‚ö°. You are all invited to come along! We have an awesome lineup of speakers, listed below, so come along and join in!
Jessica Lee Title: Why I R?

item.title: R-Ladies Sydney
item.description: About the Sydney R-Ladies group R-Ladies Sydney is part of a world-wide organization to promote gender diversity in the R community, with Australian chapters in Melbourne, Adelaide and Brisbane. The plot to set up a Sydney chapter was hatched by Jenny Richmond , with Danielle Navarro , Lisa Williams and Steph de Silva as co-conspirators, and (for the moment at least!) the four of us make up the very friendly leadership group for the chapter.

item.title: R-Ladies Sydney events
item.description: Check out some of the events we‚Äôve hosted! You can find and sign up to new events on our Meetup page. Machine Learning 101, Part 2, (17-Oct-2018) Presenter: Sarah Romanes (@sarah_romanes) Slides: https://sarahromanes.github.io/r-ladies-ML-2/#1 Github: https://github.com/sarahromanes/r-ladies-ML-2 Machine Learning 101, Part 1 (10-Oct-2018) Presenter: Sarah Romanes (@sarah_romanes) Slides: https://sarahromanes.github.io/r-ladies-ML-1/#1 Github: https://github.com/sarahromanes/r-ladies-ML-1 Shiny September: Making an interactive web app in R (19-Sep-2018) Presenter: Emi Tanaka (@statsgen) Slides: https://emitanaka.
